headline: Static vs Instance string.Equals
description:
As you may or may not know, static methods are usually faster than instance methods. This alone should be a good enough reason to use the static string.Equals methodin .NET, but if that doesnâ€™t do it for you, allow me to present a simple example.
string a = &quot;hello&quot;;string b = &quot;hi&quot;;bool result = a.Equals(b); What is the expected result of these lines? A boolean value of false, of course.
